How can I merge two or more Git commits into one[locally and remote]?

Posted on May 23, 2017

You can do this fairly easily without git rebase or git merge --squash. In this example, we'll squash the last 3 commits. If you want to write the new commit message from scratch, this suffices: git reset --soft HEAD~3 &amp;&amp; git commit If you want to start editing the new... [Read More]

Posted on May 22, 2017

Abstract: This paper proposes an approach to building a low-cost offline home automation or appliance automation by means of re-purposing old and unused smartphones by means of exploiting low-level sensors such as an accelerometer, microphone, GPS, and temperature. How to stop Jenkins CI build by extract a value from a JSON endpoint in bash using Curl

Posted on April 6, 2017

Curl the URL to get the JSON response and pipe it to the python tool. The python code will extract the value mapped to the given key (number in this case). [sourcecode language="bash"] machine='dbelab04' machineport=8080 jobname='mkat_fpga_tests_4k' buildnumber=$(curl --silent -X POST http://$machine:$machineport/job/$jobname/lastBuild/api/json?tree=number | python -c 'import json,sys;obj=json.load(sys.stdin);print obj[&quot;'number'&quot;]';) curl -X POST... [Read More]
Tags: Bash BASH script continuous intergration curl jenkins JenkinsCI
